title: Implement jit doc assets commands
description:
Add CLI commands to inspect and list assets for documents.

## Rationale

Users need to see what assets are associated with documents, verify classification (per-doc vs shared), and understand asset status before archival.

## Acceptance Criteria

### 1. Implement jit doc assets list

Command: jit doc assets list ISSUE-ID PATH [--rescan] [--json]

Functionality:
- Show assets for a document from metadata
- Display: path, type (per-doc/shared), MIME, hash, exists status
- Support --rescan to refresh from current content
- Support --json for machine-readable output

Human-readable output shows:
- Per-doc assets with status
- Shared assets  
- External URLs
- Missing assets (if any)

JSON output includes full metadata with summary counts.

### 2. Error Handling

- Issue not found → clear error
- Document not linked to issue → clear error
- Document file missing → warn, show metadata
- No assets → "No assets found for this document"

### 3. Integration Tests

- List assets for doc with various asset types
- Rescan updates metadata
- JSON output validates
- Missing document handled gracefully

### 4. Documentation

- Help text with examples
- User guide section
- Include in docs/README.md examples

## Dependencies

- Task 8: Extended metadata schema

## Success Metrics

- Command functional and user-friendly
- Supports both human and JSON output
- --rescan works correctly
- Tests cover all scenarios
